Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Identified the core steps of the invoice approval process from Mary’s account, focusing on activities like checking for a valid PO, logging the invoice, forwarding to Purchasing, matching line items, manager approval, and payment scheduling.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Recognized common roles involved (Accounts Payable Clerk, Purchasing Officer, Manager, Supervisor, Supplier Relationships) along with their corresponding activities and responsibilities as described across the interviews.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Established that the invoice approval process would flow linearly from Mary’s initial handling of the invoice to Dan’s verification, then to Carlos’s approval, and finally payment scheduling, with exceptions handled by Rita.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Cross-checked Dan’s description with Mary’s account to confirm that Purchasing validates the invoice against the PO and either confirms or holds it due to discrepancies. Integrated both perspectives into the process flow.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Generalized from Rita’s account that exceptions (e.g., missing PO, unresolved discrepancies) often escalate to her, and noted that this step reintegrates into the normal process flow after resolution.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Deduced that Karen becomes involved in steps requiring supplier communication based on her role description, even though she is not directly part of approval loops.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Validated that Carlos only acts as the final approval step once receipt is confirmed and discrepancies resolved, as stated in all interviews.

Name: Backtracking - NE
Text: Misinterpreted the order of escalation paths for missing or invalid POs between Mary and Rita, creating confusion about whether Mary directly escalates unresolved cases or loops back to the supplier multiple times.

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - IND
Text: Considered scenarios where a supplier does not provide a valid PO or resolve discrepancies—hypothesized that in such cases, Rita steps in to decide on retrospective POs or rejections, even though interview details were incomplete.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Simplified the flow by treating Rita’s resolution path as a reentry point into the next logical step of the process rather than attempting a complex multi-gateway loop for every exception scenario.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Verified that Karen’s involvement is external to the approval process and included her only in tasks requiring supplier negotiation or clarification.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Integrated Carlos’s reject-and-investigate path into the model, ensuring rejected invoices loop back for further clarification with Mary, Rita, or Dan.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Inferred from Mary’s and Rita’s accounts that Rita becoming involved depends on whether supplier and Purchasing attempts to resolve issues fail after a reasonable number of tries—an assumption not explicitly confirmed in interviews.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Created a logical pathway where unresolved discrepancies are escalated to Rita for resolution based on her stated role and integrated her resolution activities as an exception handling mechanism.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Ensured that all paths end with either payment scheduling (normal process) or rejection (exception paths) as confirmed by the roles of Mary, Carlos, and Rita.
